00020 //This class encapsulates a data structure that allows you to:
00021 // - locate a datum using its key
00022 // - efficiently access the key (and datum) for the maximum datum
00023 //Both these operations are log(n).
00024 //The datum is provided via add() and it becomes property of the class, i.e., you
00025 //must access it using getData() in future to ensure that the class copy is amended.
00026 //checkAdd() is the same as add, except it does nothing if the key is already present.
00027 //You must not duplicate keys, if you do behaviour is undefined.
00028 //Furthermore if you do call getData() and change the class copy, you must call
00029 //fixOrder() or repair() before using any other method again, or subsequent results are undefined.
00030 //The difference between fixOrder() and repair() is that the former assumes only 1 item
00031 //is out of position, while the latter assume that all are.
00032 //Finally, do not add items anywhere except the shallowest node you intend to use
00033 //the data structure, e.g., at the root node, or only use at one depth.
00034 
00035 #define left(x) (2 * x + 1)
00036 #define right(x) (2 * x + 2)
00037 #define parent(x) ((x - 1) / 2)
00038 
00039 template<typename Key, typename Data>
00040 class RandomAccessPriorityQ {
00041  public:
00042 
00043   vector<Key> heap; //heap ordered by decreasing data corresponding to key
00044   map<Key, pair<Data, size_t> > mapping; //mapping from key to data
00045   Reversible<size_t> correctSize; //tells us what the heap size should be at current depth
00046   vector<Key> removed; //vector holding keys removed at greater depths
00047   size_t lastGetDataPos; //the heap location of the key of the most recent data accessed by getData()
00048 
00049   RandomAccessPriorityQ(StateObj* stateObj) : correctSize(stateObj), lastGetDataPos(0) {}
00050 
00051   Data& getData(Key k) { 
00052     pair<Data, size_t>& data_pos = mapping.find(k)->second;
00053     lastGetDataPos = data_pos.second;
00054     return data_pos.first;
00055   }
00056 
00057   void pullUp(size_t pos) {
00058     Key pos_k = heap[pos];
00059     pair<Data, size_t>& data_pos = mapping.find(pos_k)->second;
00060     while(true) {
00061       if(pos == 0) break;
00062       Key parent_k = heap[parent(pos)];
00063       pair<Data, size_t>& parent_data_pos = mapping.find(parent_k)->second;
00064       if(parent_data_pos.first < data_pos.first) {
00065         heap[pos] = parent_k;
00066         parent_data_pos.second = pos;
00067         pos = parent(pos);
00068       } else
00069         break;
00070       }
00071       heap[pos] = pos_k;
00072       data_pos.second = pos;
00073   }
00074 
00075   void pullDown(size_t pos) {
00076     Key init_k = heap[pos];
00077     pair<Data, size_t>& init_data_pos = mapping.find(init_k)->second;
00078     size_t heap_s = heap.size();
00079     while(true) {
00080       int left = left(pos);
00081       if(left >= heap_s) //no children
00082     break;
00083       else { //left child at least
00084         Key left_k = heap[left];
00085         pair<Data, size_t>& left_data_pos = mapping.find(left_k)->second;
00086         int right = right(pos);
00087         if(right >= heap_s) { //no right child
00088           if(init_data_pos.first < left_data_pos.first) { //but left child is larger
00089             heap[pos] = left_k; //so swap the left child and current around and then stop
00090             left_data_pos.second = pos;
00091             pos = left;
00092           }
00093           break;
00094         } else { //both left and right children
00095           Key right_k = heap[right];
00096           pair<Data, size_t>& right_data_pos = mapping.find(right_k)->second;
00097           if(right_data_pos.first < left_data_pos.first) {
00098             if(init_data_pos.first < left_data_pos.first) { //left child is largest
00099               heap[pos] = left_k; //so bring it up
00100               left_data_pos.second = pos;
00101               pos = left(pos);
00102             } else {
00103               break;
00104             }
00105           } else {
00106             if(init_data_pos.first < right_data_pos.first) { //right child is largest
00107               heap[pos] = right_k;
00108               right_data_pos.second = pos;
00109               pos = right(pos);
00110             } else {
00111               break;
00112             }
00113           }
00114         }
00115       }
00116     }
00117     heap[pos] = init_k; //put into final position
00118     init_data_pos.second = pos;
00119   }
00120 
00121   void checkCorrectSize() {
00122     for(int i = heap.size(); i < correctSize; i++) {
00123       heap.push_back(removed.back());
00124       removed.pop_back();
00125       pullUp(heap.size() - 1);
00126     }
00127     D_ASSERT(heap.size() == correctSize);
00128     if(heap.size() != 0)
00129       D_ASSERT(checkHeap());
00130   }
00131 
00132   size_t size() { checkCorrectSize(); return correctSize; }
00133 
00134   void clear() { correctSize = 0; heap.clear(); mapping.clear(); }
00135 
00136   Key getMaxKey() { checkCorrectSize(); return heap[0]; }
00137 
00138   void removeMax() {
00139     checkCorrectSize();
00140     removed.push_back(heap[0]);
00141     heap[0] = heap[heap.size() - 1];
00142     heap.pop_back();
00143     --correctSize;
00144     if(heap.size() != 0) {
00145       pullDown(0);
00146       D_ASSERT(checkHeap());
00147     }
00148   }
00149 
00150   void fixOrder() { pullUp(lastGetDataPos); pullDown(lastGetDataPos); D_ASSERT(checkHeap()); }
00151 
00152   void repair() {
00153     const size_t heap_s = heap.size();
00154     for(int i = 0; i < heap_s; i++)
00155       pullUp(i);
00156     D_ASSERT(checkHeap());
00157   }
00158 
00159   void add(Key k, Data d) {
00160     checkCorrectSize(); 
00161     D_ASSERT(mapping.find(k) == mapping.end()); //check that it's a unique key
00162     ++correctSize;
00163     mapping.insert(make_pair(k, make_pair(d, 0))); //position is wrong ...
00164     heap.push_back(k);
00165     pullUp(heap.size() - 1); //but this function will correct the position
00166     D_ASSERT(checkHeap());
00167   }
00168 
00169   void checkAdd(Key k, Data d) {
00170     if(mapping.find(k) == mapping.end())
00171       add(k, d);
00172   }
00173 
00174   bool checkHeap() { checkHeap(0); }
00175 
00176   bool checkHeap(size_t pos) {
00177     size_t heap_s = heap.size();
00178     D_ASSERT(pos < heap_s);
00179     pair<Data,size_t>& data_pos = mapping.find(heap[pos])->second;
00180     Data& data = data_pos.first;
00181     D_ASSERT(pos == data_pos.second); //check stored pos is correct
00182     if(left(pos) >= heap_s) //left not present
00183       return true; //no children => is a heap
00184     else //left is present
00185       if(right(pos) >= heap_s) { //left child only
00186           bool left_ok = !(data < getData(heap[left(pos)])) && checkHeap(left(pos));
00187           D_ASSERT(left_ok);
00188           return left_ok;
00189       } else { //both children present
00190           bool both_ok = !(data < getData(heap[left(pos)])) && !(data < getData(heap[right(pos)])) &&
00191             checkHeap(left(pos)) && checkHeap(right(pos));
00192           D_ASSERT(both_ok);
00193           return both_ok;
00194       }
00195   }
00196 };
00197 
00198 /* Below is the code that I used to test this ADT. Both require access to
00199 a definition like   
00200 
00201 RandomAccessPriorityQ<unsigned, int> test(stateObj);
00202 
00203   cout << "begin rapq BT test" << endl;
00204   
00205   bttest.clear();
00206   
00207   for(unsigned j = 0; j < 10; j++) {
00208   bttest.add(j, j);
00209   }
00210   
00211   cout << bttest.heap << endl;
00212   getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().world_push();
00213   for(unsigned j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
00214   bttest.removeMax();
00215   }
00216   cout << bttest.heap << endl;
00217   getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().world_push();
00218   for(unsigned j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
00219   bttest.removeMax();
00220   }
00221   cout << bttest.size() << endl;
00222   getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().world_pop();
00223   cout << bttest.getMax().first << endl;
00224   getMemory(stateObj).backTrack().world_pop();
00225   cout << bttest.getMax().first << endl;
00226   
00227   cout << "end rapq BT test" << endl;
00228   
00229   cout << "begin testing rapq" << endl;
00230   
00231   for(unsigned j = 0; j < 30; j++) {
00232   test.add(j, j);
00233   }
00234   
00235   cout << test.heap << endl;
00236   
00237   int nums[] = {6,11,21,2,1,29,30,5,13,12,14,17,20,22,3,4,25,26,10,23,28,18,16,7,27,9,8,15,19,24};
00238   for(int j = 0; j < 30; j++) {
00239   test.getData(test.getMax().first) = -nums[j];
00240   test.fixOrder();
00241   }
00242   
00243   cout << test.heap << endl;
00244   
00245   cout << test.getData(test.heap[0]);
00246   for(unsigned j = 1; j < 30; j++)
00247   cout << "," <<  test.getData(test.heap[j]);
00248   cout << endl;
00249   
00250   for(int j = 0; j < 30; j++) {
00251   cout << test.getMax().second << " ";
00252   test.removeMax();
00253   }
00254   cout << endl;
00255   
00256   D_ASSERT(test.size() == 0);
00257   
00258   cout << "end testing rapq" << endl;
00259 */
